pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:0.5: 30. The training rule on the ending of the robe-making season
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.2: At that time a lay follower had built a dwelling for the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.3: He wanted to give out-of-season robe-cloth to both Sanghas at the presentation ceremony for that dwelling,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.4: but both Sanghas had already done the robe-making procedure.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.5: That lay follower then approached the Sangha and asked it to make an end of the robe-making season.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.7: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.8: “Monks, I allow you to end the robe-making season.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.9: And it should be done like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.10: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.11: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.12: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should end the robe-making season.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.14: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.15: The Sangha ends the robe-making season.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.16: Any monk who approves of ending the robe-making season should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.17: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.18: The Sangha has made an end of the robe-making season. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.1: That lay follower then went to the Sangha of nuns and asked them to end the robe-making season.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.3: But the nun Thullanandā, aiming to get robe-cloth for herself, blocked the Sangha from doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.4: That lay follower complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.5: “How can the nuns not end the robe-making season for us?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.6: The nuns heard the complaints of that lay follower.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.8: “How could Venerable Thullanandā block a legitimate ending of the robe-making season?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.9: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.12: “… How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.14: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.15.1: ‘If a nun blocks a legitimate ending of the robe-making season, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.5: A legitimate ending of the robe-making season:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.6: a unanimous Sangha of nuns brings it to an end.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.8: if she blocks it with the thought, “What can be done so that the robe-making season doesn’t end?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.9.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she blocks it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.10: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she blocks it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.11: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she blocks it, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.12: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.13: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.14: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.2: if she blocks it after demonstrating a benefit;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.5: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.6: The third sub-chapter on nakedness is finished.
